ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Really fascinating course. This is one of those courses that reminds me just how grateful I am to attend University. This class has fundamentally changed how I view memory, culture, and society.
Interesting look at theoretical and practical explorations of memory. Learned a good amount and was thought-provoking -- but not life-changing.
Theoretical concepts related to memory and memoir.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: Really interesting classes with engaging discussion. Sometimes wish it was more seminar-esque, and less in the style of a high school class. For all of the reading we do, it would be nice to discuss it further.

A little more of a directed point to be delivered and considered in each class. The breadth of experience of the students (from advanced grad students to STEM undergrads) seemed to make discussions tough at times.

Only strengths. The professor is iconic, and has very realisitic expectations for students in that you aren't expected to perfectly grasp every single theoretical concept related to memory and memoir. I had trouble with some (some theoretical texts are incredibly hard to understand!) but then you come to class and the professor explains it all in such a way that allows you to internalize much of it just from lecture. You are expected to apply yourself in your own way, and that depends on each student individually. You're given feedback how you want it, if you want a lot of it you'll have it. The professor is very responsive to emails as well. No weaknesses!

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: I would absolutely recommend it, but I would caution against hubris. It's a difficult class with very cool content. Take it!!
Yes, if you're interested in the topic and willing to take the initiative on exploring it even beyond class discussions.

Absolutely yes! I found that the course might be especially relevant to aspiring writers. Great professor who sincerely cares for his students. Realistic expectations of students as well, which is important.
